I like your page Max (Hope you don't mind my adding a link to our FAQ).  
If you give me a comment on the difference between  
http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~schoefma/howto/run_heritrix_on_windows/heritrix.cmd 
and whats currently in 1.10.1, I'll update whats at 
$HERITRIX_HOME/src/scripts.

Good stuff Max,
St.Ack

Maximilian Schoefmann wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I noticed on Windows Server 2003 that the owner of my files wsa set to the
> group "Administrators" instead of my own user. Java will then caugh on the
> JMX passwords file, even if the permissions were fixed. For a solution,
> see:
>
> http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~schoefma/howto/run_heritrix_on_windows/#trouble 
> <http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/%7Eschoefma/howto/run_heritrix_on_windows/#trouble>
>
> There is unfortunately no command line trick (on a default Windows
> installation) to set the ownership of a file from the script.
>
> HTH,
> Max
>
>
